summary: The Veterinary Services to Improve Public Health in Rural Communities Act aims to provide public health veterinary services, particularly within Indian Tribes and Tribal organizations, to prevent and control zoonotic diseases. It authorizes the Secretary, acting through the Indian Health Service, to fund veterinary services like spaying/neutering, diagnosis, surveillance, and vaccination. It mandates a study by the Secretary of Agriculture on the feasibility of oral rabies vaccines in Arctic regions and amends the Prepare for and Respond to Existing Viruses, Emerging New Threats, and Pandemics Act to include the Director of the Indian Health Service in the One Health framework.
